intro: Mapouria paradoxalis, commonly known as the paradoxical mapouria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, sometimes aromatic pulp. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
